org.jtrim2.collections

Interface Streamable<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the elements of the streams returned
    All Superinterfaces:
    ForEachable<T>

    public interface Streamable<T>
extends ForEachable<T>
    Provides a factory interface for Stream instances. That is, this interface provides a subset of the functionality of Iterable with the advantage of being implementable as a lambda.

    If you want to create an instance of Streamable from a Collection, then prefer to use the Streamable.fromCollection factory method, as it provides a (usually) more efficient implementation for the forEach method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void forEach(Consumer<? super T> action)
      Iterates over the backing data source, and calls the given action for each element (exactly once per element).
      static <T> Streamable<T> fromCollection(Collection<T> src)
      Returns a Streamable backed by the given Collection.
      Stream<T> stream()
      Returns a new Stream which can be used to iterate over the backing data source.

    • Method Detail

      • fromCollection

        static <T> Streamable<T> fromCollection(Collection<T> src)
        Returns a Streamable backed by the given Collection. All the methods of this interface will delegate to the method of the backing collection of the same name.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements of the streams returned
        Parameters:
        src - the backing collection. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a Streamable backed by the given Collection. This method never returns null.

      • stream

        Stream<T> stream()
        Returns a new Stream which can be used to iterate over the backing data source.
        Returns:
        a new Stream which can be used to iterate over the backing data source. This method may never return null.

      • forEach

        default void forEach(Consumer<? super T> action)
        Iterates over the backing data source, and calls the given action for each element (exactly once per element). The order of the iteration (and if it is done concurrently or not) is implementation dependent.

        Exceptions thrown by the provided action are propagated to the caller of forEach.

        Specified by:
        forEach in interface ForEachable<T>
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be called for each element of the backing data source. This argument cannot be null.
